main event: A witness in McKeeaport, Pennsylvania reported seeing a single bright, shiny object in the sky for about 3-6 seconds on June 2, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to make a 90-degree turn at one point, according to one witness, but the other witness stated there was no motion or change in course.
The object was described as being very bright, like a 'spotter's light' on an airplane.
Estimates of the object's speed ranged from 2,229 mph to 4,500 mph.
The object was estimated to be about 4,000 yards away from the witnesses.
The Air Force investigator concluded the sighting was likely a 'probable meteor' based on the short duration and trail-like appearance.
